info.name: Total Code Umbraco Json-rpc Api Documented

request.description:
### Use this procedure to create new Tenants in Umbraco

**required objects:**

 - authorization: [this is the total code api information to authenticate with umbraco to process requests]
	- AppId (Guid)
	- ApiKey (Guid)
 - tenant:
	- TenantUid (Guid) example => 28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493
	- Username (string) *umbraco uses email address as username; example => myemail@email.com
	- Name (string) example => "John Doe"
	- Password (string) *minimum of 10 characters; example => 'Password!1234'
	- Email (string) example => myemail@email.com
	- Group (string) *group name for the tenant; example => "John Doe's Group"
	- BrandName (string) example => "John Doe's Shop"
	- Domain (string) *domain with no http:// i.e. 'totalumbraco.com'
	- Subdomain (string) *only cname i.e. 'tenantsite'
	- Languages:
		- Default (string) *ISO 639-1 standard language codes; example => 'en-US'
		- Alternate (string array) *ISO 639-1 standard language codes; example => 'es-ES'
	- Currencies:
		- Codes (string) *ISO 4217 country currency code; example => 'USD'
	- AppId (Guid) example => be576e8d-ac9c-4eba-9088-a81d2b363399
	- ApiKey (Guid) example => b1dfca33-2ad7-4bd0-b2a2-365cb8977e7d
	
#### Since the procedure is Json-Rpc, it must be wrapped with Json-Rpc objects

		{
			"method": <<Method Name>>,
			"params": <<parameters for the request>>,
			"id": <<id of the request>>
		}
		
		
#### Example

		{
		    "method": "CreateTenant",
		    "params": {
		        "authorization": {
		            "AppId": "4d53bce03ec34c0a911182d4c228ee6c",
		            "ApiKey": "zYPSLb7uYA1NHFHtvZw+DGyqJr2P2/sT8puaAP+NFgs="
		        },
		        "tenant": {
		            "TenantUid": "be576e8d-ac9c-4eba-9088-a81d2b363399",
		            "Username": "janetaylor@outlook.com",
		            "Password": "Password!123",
		            "Email": "janetaylor@outlook.com",
		            "Group": "Jane's Group",
		            "BrandName": "Jane Taylor Site",
		            "Domain": "totalumbraco.com",
		            "SubDomain": "jane",
		            "Name": "Jane Taylor",
		            "Languages": {
		                "Default": "en-Us",
		                "Alternate": [
		                    "en-GB",
		                    "es-ES"
		                ]
		            },
		            "Currencies": {
		                "Codes": [
		                    "USD",
		                    "EUR"
		                ]
		            },
		            "AppId": "778edd8c-3d84-44db-8e58-a548c1250d2d",
		            "ApiKey": "b1dfca33-2ad7-4bd0-b2a2-365cb8977e7d"
		        }
		    },
		    "id": 1
		}
		
### Returns extended Tenant with Umbraco System Details

#### Example

		{
		    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
		    "result": {
		        "Message": "Tenant Created",
		        "TenantUid": "b4366529-cb61-43ca-a8ef-7c82adf7fe67",
		        "Status": "Ok",
		        "Data": {
		            "extended": {
		                "Tenant": {
		                    "ApiKey": "ca36640d-1904-4b03-9faa-232bf22e8304",
		                    "AppId": "3eeccb82-5c31-44a9-b0a1-1fdc20628178",
		                    "BrandName": "Tenant Example Site",
		                    "Currencies": {
		                        "Codes": [
		                            "USD",
		                            "EUR",
		                            "BRL"
		                        ]
		                    },
		                    "Domain": "totalumbraco.com",
		                    "Languages": {
		                        "Default": "en-Us",
		                        "Alternate": [
		                            "en-GB",
		                            "es-ES",
		                            "pt-BR",
		                            "fr-FR"
		                        ]
		                    },
		                    "Name": "Example Name",
		                    "Password": "Password!123",
		                    "Email": "example@email.com",
		                    "SubDomain": "example",
		                    "TenantUId": "b4366529-cb61-43ca-a8ef-7c82adf7fe67",
		                    "Username": "example@email.com",
		                    "Group": "Tenant Example Group"
		                },
		                "StartContentId": 1066,
		                "StartMediaId": 1067,
		                "Permissions": [
		                    "I",
		                    "P",
		                    "K",
		                    "F",
		                    "ï",
		                    "D",
		                    "C",
		                    "U",
		                    "A",
		                    "O",
		                    "S"
		                ],
		                "AllowedSectionAliases": [
		                    "content",
		                    "media"
		                ],
		                "UserId": 0
		            }
		        }
		    },
		    "id": 1
		}
		
		
## Possible Errors

		Unhandled = -999,
        DefaultLanguageIsMandatory = 400,
        DuplicateTenantUid = 501,
        DuplicateTenantBrandName = 502,
        DuplicateTenantDomain = 503,
        TenantAlreadyExists = 507,
        DomainAlreadyAssigned = 601,
        DomainMalformatted = 602,
        SubDomainIsRequired = 603,
        UsernameAlreadyExists = 701,
        UsernameMalformed = 702,
        MediaNodeAlreadyExists = 800,
        GroupAlreadyExists = 900

### Use this procedure to edit Tenants in Umbraco

**required objects:**

 - authorization: [this is the total code api information to authenticate with umbraco to process requests]
	- AppId (Guid)
	- ApiKey (Guid)
	
    - User: [optional] * Used when needing to update the main user for the Tenant
    	- TenantUId (Guid) example => "d7433649-7f63-4a87-838f-b87ad52ac778"
        - Name (string) example => "Jane Taylor"
    	- Username (string) *umbraco uses email address as username; example => "janetaylor@outlook.com"
        - Password (string) *minimum of 10 characters; example => 'Password!1234'
        - Email (string) example => "janetaylor@outlook.com"
        - Group (string) *group name for the tenant; example => "Jane's Group"
        
    - Group: [optional] * Used when needing to update the main group for the Tenant
        - Name (string) *group's current name; example => "Jane's Group"
        - Alias (string) [optional] *by default, the alias is created from the group's name; example => "janesgroup"
        - RenameGroupTo (string) *new name for the group; example => "Test 1"
        - TenantUId (Guid) *must be the same as tenant, to make sure there's no tampering with other tenants; example => "d7433649-7f63-4a87-838f-b87ad52ac778"
        - StartContentId (int) *this is the content home for the tenant, returned from the create tenant procedure; example => 1064
        - StartMediaId (int) *this is the media home for the tenant, returned from the create tenant procedure; example => 1065
        - Permissions (string array) *array of permissions for the group (functionalities permitted); example => "I","P","K","F","ï","D","C","U","A","O","S" (these are default)
        - AllowedSectionAliases (string array) *array of sections the group is allowed to access, currently must be set to only "content" and "media"

	-Tenant [required] * Used to update the tenant information in Umbraco
        - TenantUid (Guid) *must match other tenantUids; example => "d7433649-7f63-4a87-838f-b87ad52ac778"
        - BrandName (string) *the brandname for the tenant; example => "Test site 1"
        - Domain (string) *domain with no http:// i.e. 'totalumbraco.com'
		- Subdomain (string) *only cname i.e. 'tenantsite'
		- Languages:
			- Default (string) *ISO 639-1 standard language codes; example => 'en-US'
			- Alternate (string array) *ISO 639-1 standard language codes; example => 'es-ES'
		- Currencies:
			- Codes (string) *ISO 4217 country currency code; example => 'USD'
		- AppId (Guid) example => be576e8d-ac9c-4eba-9088-a81d2b363399
		- ApiKey (Guid) example => b1dfca33-2ad7-4bd0-b2a2-365cb8977e7d
	
#### Since the procedure is Json-Rpc, it must be wrapped with Json-Rpc objects

		{
			"method": <<Method Name>>,
			"params": <<parameters for the request>>,
			"id": <<id of the request>>
		}
		
#### Example:

		{
		    "method": "EditTenant",
		    "params": {
		        "authorization": {
		            "AppId": "4d53bce03ec34c0a911182d4c228ee6c",
		            "ApiKey": "zYPSLb7uYA1NHFHtvZw+DGyqJr2P2/sT8puaAP+NFgs="
		        },
		        "user": {
		        	"TenantUId": "d7433649-7f63-4a87-838f-b87ad52ac778",
		        	"Name": "Jane Taylor",
		        	"Username": "janetaylor@outlook.com",
		            "Password": "Password!123",
		            "Email": "janetaylor2@outlook.com",
		            "Group": "Jane's Group"
		        },
		        "group": {
		            "Name": "Jane's Group",
		            "Alias": "janesgroup",
		            "RenameGroupTo":"Test 12",
		            "TenantUId": "d7433649-7f63-4a87-838f-b87ad52ac778",
		            "StartContentId": 1064,
		            "StartMediaId": 1065,
		            "Permissions": [
		                "I",
		                "P",
		                "K",
		                "F",
		                "ï",
		                "D",
		                "C",
		                "U",
		                "A",
		                "O",
		                "S"
		            ],
		            "AllowedSectionAliases": [
		                "content",
		                "media"
		            ]
		        },
		        "tenant": {
		            "TenantUid": "d7433649-7f63-4a87-838f-b87ad52ac778",
		            "BrandName": "Dilek Test Site 10",
		            "Domain": "totalumbraco.com",
		            "SubDomain": "dilek10",
		            "Languages": {
		                "Default": "en-GB",
		                "Alternate": [
		                    "es-ES",
		                    "pt-BR",
		                    "fr-FR"
		                ]
		            },
		            "Currencies": {
		                "Codes": [
		                    "USD",
		                    "EUR",
		                    "BRL"
		                ]
		            },
		            "AppId": "be576e8d-ac9c-4eba-9088-a81d2b363399",
		            "ApiKey": "b1dfca33-2ad7-4bd0-b2a2-365cb8977e7d"
		        }
		    },
		    "id": 2
		}
		
### Returns an extended Tenant with newly updated Umbraco Details

#### Example

		{
		    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
		    "result": {
		        "Message": "Tenant edited",
		        "TenantUid": "b4366529-cb61-43ca-a8ef-7c82adf7fe67",
		        "Status": "Ok",
		        "Data": {
		            "Tenant": {
		                "ApiKey": "b1dfca33-2ad7-4bd0-b2a2-365cb8977e7d",
		                "AppId": "be576e8d-ac9c-4eba-9088-a81d2b363399",
		                "BrandName": "Bob Site",
		                "Currencies": {
		                    "Codes": [
		                        "USD",
		                        "EUR",
		                        "BRL"
		                    ]
		                },
		                "Domain": "totalumbraco.com",
		                "Languages": {
		                    "Default": "en-Us",
		                    "Alternate": [
		                        "en-GB",
		                        "es-ES",
		                        "pt-BR",
		                        "fr-FR",
		                        "aa-DJ"
		                    ]
		                },
		                "Name": null,
		                "Password": null,
		                "Email": null,
		                "SubDomain": "bobs",
		                "TenantUId": "b4366529-cb61-43ca-a8ef-7c82adf7fe67",
		                "Username": null,
		                "Group": null
		            },
		            "StartContentId": 1066,
		            "StartMediaId": 1067,
		            "Permissions": null,
		            "AllowedSectionAliases": null,
		            "UserId": 0
		        }
		    },
		    "id": 2
		}
		
## Possible Errors

		Unhandled = -999,
        DefaultLanguageIsMandatory = 400,
        DuplicateTenantBrandName = 502,
        DuplicateTenantDomain = 503,
        TenantNotFound = 504,
        DomainAlreadyAssigned = 601,
        DomainMalformatted = 602,
        SubDomainIsRequired = 603,
        UsernameMalformed = 702,
        UsernameDoesNotExist = 705,
        GroupDoesNotExist = 901

### Use this procedure to Disable a Tenant in Umbraco

**required objects:**

 - authorization: [this is the total code api information to authenticate with umbraco to process requests]
	- AppId (Guid)
	- ApiKey (Guid)
 - tenant:
	- TenantUid (Guid) example => "28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493"
    - Username (string) *the user to be disabled, usually the main user; example => "bobdylan@outlook.com"
    - Group (string) *the group to be disabled, usually the main group; example => "Bob's Group"

#### Since the procedure is Json-Rpc, it must be wrapped with Json-Rpc objects

		{
			"method": <<Method Name>>,
			"params": <<parameters for the request>>,
			"id": <<id of the request>>
		}
		
#### Example 

		{
		    "method": "DisableTenant",
		    "params": {
		        "authorization": {
		            "AppId": "4d53bce03ec34c0a911182d4c228ee6c",
		            "ApiKey": "zYPSLb7uYA1NHFHtvZw+DGyqJr2P2/sT8puaAP+NFgs="
		        },
		       "tenant": {
		            "TenantUid": "28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493",
		            "Username": "bobdylan@outlook.com",
		            "Group": "Bob's Group"
		        }
		    },
		    "id": 4
		}
		
### Returns confirmation of Tenant Disabled


#### Example

		{
		    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
		    "result": {
		        "Message": "Tenant disabled",
		        "TenantUid": "28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493",
		        "Status": "Ok",
		        "Data": null
		    },
		    "id": 3
		}
		
## Possible Errors

		Unhandled = -999,
        TenantNotFound = 504,
        TenantAlreadyDisabled = 505,
        UsernameAlreadyDisabled = 703,
        UsernameDoesNotExist = 705,
        GroupDoesNotExist = 901

### Use this procedure to Enable a Tenant in Umbraco

**required objects:**

 - authorization: [this is the total code api information to authenticate with umbraco to process requests]
	- AppId (Guid)
	- ApiKey (Guid)
 - tenant:
	- TenantUid (Guid) example => "28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493"
    - Username (string) *the user to be enabled, usually the main user; example => "bobdylan@outlook.com"
    - Group (string) *the group to be enabled, usually the main group; example => "Bob's Group"

#### Since the procedure is Json-Rpc, it must be wrapped with Json-Rpc objects

		{
			"method": <<Method Name>>,
			"params": <<parameters for the request>>,
			"id": <<id of the request>>
		}
		
#### Example 		
		
		{
		    "method": "EnableTenant",
		    "params": {
		        "authorization": {
		            "AppId": "4d53bce03ec34c0a911182d4c228ee6c",
		            "ApiKey": "zYPSLb7uYA1NHFHtvZw+DGyqJr2P2/sT8puaAP+NFgs="
		        },
		        "tenant": {
		            "TenantUid": "28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493",
		            "Username": "bobdylan@outlook.com",
		            "Group": "Bob's Group"
		        }
		    },
		    "id": 5
		}
		
### Returns confirmation that Tenant has been enabled

#### Example

		{
		    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
		    "result": {
		        "Message": "Tenant enabled",
		        "TenantUid": "28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493",
		        "Status": "Ok",
		        "Data": null
		    },
		    "id": 5
		}
		
## Possible Errors

		Unhandled = -999,
        TenantNotFound = 504,
        TenantAlreadyEnabled = 506,
        UsernameAlreadyEnabled = 704,
        UsernameDoesNotExist = 705,
        GroupDoesNotExist = 901

### Use this procedure to create new User in Umbraco

**required objects:**

 - authorization: [this is the total code api information to authenticate with umbraco to process requests]
	- AppId (Guid)
	- ApiKey (Guid)
 - User:
	- TenantUid (Guid) example => 28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493
	- Name (string) example => "John Doe"
	- Password (string) *minimum of 10 characters; example => 'Password!1234'
	- Email (string) example => myemail@email.com
	- Username (string) *umbraco uses email address as username; example => myemail@email.com
	- Group (string) *group name for the tenant; example => "John Doe's Group"
	
#### Since the procedure is Json-Rpc, it must be wrapped with Json-Rpc objects

		{
			"method": <<Method Name>>,
			"params": <<parameters for the request>>,
			"id": <<id of the request>>
		}
		
		
#### Example	
	
		{
		    "method": "CreateUser",
		    "params": {
		        "authorization": {
		            "AppId": "4d53bce03ec34c0a911182d4c228ee6c",
		            "ApiKey": "zYPSLb7uYA1NHFHtvZw+DGyqJr2P2/sT8puaAP+NFgs="
		        },
		        "user": {
		            "TenantUid": "28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493",
		            "Name": "Jane Doe",
		            "Password": "Password1234!",
		            "Email": "janedoe@outlook.com",
		            "Username": "janedoe@outlook.com",
		            "Group": "Bob's Group"
		        }
		    },
		    "id": 8
		}
		
### Returns confirmation the user has been created

#### Example

		{
		    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
		    "result": {
		        "Message": "User created",
		        "TenantUid": "28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493",
		        "Status": "Ok",
		        "Data": "9"
		    },
		    "id": 8
		}
		
## Possible Errors

		Unhandled = -999,
        TenantNotFound = 504,
        UsernameAlreadyExists = 701,

### Use this procedure to create new Group in Umbraco

**required objects:**

 - authorization: [this is the total code api information to authenticate with umbraco to process requests]
	- AppId (Guid)
	- ApiKey (Guid)
	
 - Group:
    - Name (string) *group's current name; example => "Jane's Group"
    - Alias (string) [optional] *by default, the alias is created from the group's name; example => "janesgroup"
    - RenameGroupTo (string) *new name for the group; example => "Test 1"
    - TenantUId (Guid) *must be the same as tenant, to make sure there's no tampering with other tenants; example => "d7433649-7f63-4a87-838f-b87ad52ac778"
    - StartContentId (int) *this is the content home for the tenant, returned from the create tenant procedure; example => 1064
    - StartMediaId (int) *this is the media home for the tenant, returned from the create tenant procedure; example => 1065
    - Permissions (string array) *array of permissions for the group (functionalities permitted); example => "I","P","K","F","ï","D","C","U","A","O","S" (these are default)
    - AllowedSectionAliases (string array) *array of sections the group is allowed to access, currently must be set to only "content" and "media"
	
#### Since the procedure is Json-Rpc, it must be wrapped with Json-Rpc objects

		{
			"method": <<Method Name>>,
			"params": <<parameters for the request>>,
			"id": <<id of the request>>
		}
		
		
#### Example			
		
		{
		    "method": "CreateGroup",
		    "params": {
		        "authorization": {
		            "AppId": "4d53bce03ec34c0a911182d4c228ee6c",
		            "ApiKey": "zYPSLb7uYA1NHFHtvZw+DGyqJr2P2/sT8puaAP+NFgs="
		        },
		        "group": {
		            "Name": "Test 1",
		            "TenantUId": "28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493",
		            "StartContentId": 1066,
		            "StartMediaId": 1067,
		            "Permissions": [
		                "I",
		                "P",
		                "K",
		                "F",
		                "ï",
		                "D",
		                "C",
		                "U",
		                "A",
		                "O",
		                "S"
		            ],
		            "AllowedSectionAliases": [
		                "content",
		                "media"
		            ]
		        }
		    },
		    "id": 11
		}
		
### Returns Confirmation the new group has been created, and the Group Id in Umbraco

#### Example

		{
		    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
		    "result": {
		        "Message": "Group Test 1 Created",
		        "TenantUid": "28d978f9-e9e1-4629-b246-97eec59b2493",
		        "Status": "Ok",
		        "Data": {
		            "groupId": "13"
		        }
		    },
		    "id": 11
		}
		
## Possible Errors

		Unhandled = -999,
        GroupAlreadyExists = 900,
